name: Tiny Curves
comment: Very small curve (and one circle) detectors. Many of these units respond to a range of curvatures all the way from a flat line to a curve.

name: Early Brightness Gradient
comment: These units detect oriented gradients in brightness. They support a variety of similar units in the next layer.

name: Line Divergence
comment: These units detect lines diverging from a point.

name: Color Contrast
comment: These units detect a color on side of the receptive field, and a different color on the oppositie side. Composed of lower-level color contrast detectors, they often respond to color transitions in a range of translation and orientation variations.

name: Gabor Textures
comment: Like complex Gabor units from the previous layer, but larger. They're probably starting to be better described as a texture.

name: Hatch Textures
comment: These units detect Gabor patterns in two orthogonal directions, selecting for a "hatch" pattern.

name: Texture Contrast
comment: These units look for different textures on opposite sides of their receptive field. One side is typically a Gabor pattern.

name: Textures
comment: A broad category of units detecting repeating local structure.

name: Line
comment: These units are beginning to look for a single primary line. Some look for different colors on each side. Many exhibit "combing" (small perpendicular lines along the main one), a very common but not presently understood phenomenon in line-like features across vision models.

name: Corners
comment: These units detect two Gabor patterens which meet at apprixmately 90 degrees, causing them to respond to corners.

name: Shifted Line
comment: These units look for edges "shifted" the side of the receptive field instead of the middle. This may be linked to the many 1x1 convs in the next layer.

name: Color/Multicolor
comment: Several units look for mixtures of colors but seem indifferent to their organization.

name: Color Center-Surround
comment: These units look for one color in the middle and another (typically opposite) on the boundary. Genereally more sensitive to the center than boundary.

name: Other Units
comment: Catch-all category for all other units.
